intro: Siphocampylus megalanthus var. costaricanus, commonly known as the Costa Rican giant bellflower, is a striking member of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude cloud forests of Costa Rica, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its large, showy bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its leaves are broad and oval, often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. This variant is noted for its unique floral morphology and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
